definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
like a second parent (idiom); one's great benefactor

sentences.english: Her own parents were later reunited with her in France.
sentences.chinese: 后来，她的亲生父母在法国和她团聚了。

sentences.english: SEEMA: Her biological father is very much what we wanted.
sentences.chinese: 我们非常想拥有她的生父权。

sentences.english: Andy saw John wei, know that he is her father Wei Wei mouth.
sentences.chinese: 安迪见到魏国强，知道他就是魏渭口中她的生父。

sentences.english: Father is not known and mother is foreigner.
sentences.chinese: 父无可考或生父未认领，母为外国人者。

sentences.english: One particularly interesting report involved the detailing of Steve’s father.
sentences.chinese: 一段特别有趣的报道是关于史蒂夫的生父。

sentences.english: We think that they're taking the children to their real parents in the US.
sentences.chinese: 我们猜他们想把孩子带到美国投靠亲生父母。

sentences.english: He decided to try and track down his biological parents."It
sentences.chinese: 他决定去找回他的亲生父母。

sentences.english: When did your father and your mother devoice?
sentences.chinese: 你生父与你母亲是什么时候分手的？

sentences.english: Surrogate shall be artificially inseminated with the semen of Natural Father by a physician.
sentences.chinese: 代孕妈妈将由医生用生父的精子进行人工受精。

sentences.english: Luo's foster family agreed to cooperate to look for Luo's birth parents.
sentences.chinese: 收养罗的家庭同意协助找罗的亲生父母。

sentences.english: He decided to try and track down his biological parents.
sentences.chinese: 他决定去找回他的亲生父母。

definition: (of siblings) having the same father but different mothers/half (brother or sister)
one's own (child) (i.e. one's child by birth)/biological (parents)/birth (parents)
(of siblings) having the same mother but different fathers/half (brother or sister)
